intro: Euchroma, commonly known as the white hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often white or pale-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. The plants typically have palmately lobed leaves and are native to regions in Europe and Asia. Euchroma species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. They are noted for their ornamental value and have been cultivated for their attractive foliage and floral display.
